name: .BUNDLE File Extension
summary: Learn about .BUNDLE files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A BUNDLE file is a loadable bundle used by macOS or a macOS application. System-level BUNDLE files contain a collection of related files to which macOS needs access. App-specific BUNDLE files are typically used as plug-ins.

content: While BUNDLE files appear as singular files in Finder, they are actually macOS packages (which contain a collection of files). Many of macOS's BUNDLE files are stored in sub-directories of the following directory:
These files contain various data used by macOS and default macOS applications.
In contrast, app-specific BUNDLE files are often stored in an app's installation or support directory.

instructions: BUNDLE files are not meant to be opened manually. However, if you want to view a BUNDLE file's contents in macOS, you can do so by:

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
